text.__SUMMARY__: Auristomia erjaveciana is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Pyramidellidae, the pyrams and their allies.
text.Description: The size of the shell varies between 1.9 mm and 3 mm. The shell is smooth. The aperture is large and auriculate.
text.Distribution:
This species occurs in the following locations:
European waters (ERMS scope) : Mediterranean Sea
Greek Exclusive Economic Zone
Portuguese Exclusive Economic Zone
Spanish Exclusive Economic Zone
text.References:
van Aartsen J.J. & Menkhorst H.P.M.G. (1996) Nordsieck's Pyramidellidae (Gastropoda Prosobranchia): A revision of his types. Part 1: The genera Chrysallida, Ondina (s.n. Evalea) and Menestho. Basteria 60(1-3: 45-56. [23 August 1996
Giannuzzi-Savelli R., Pusateri F., Micali, P., Nofroni, I., Bartolini S. (2014). Atlante delle conchiglie marine del Mediterraneo, vol. 5 (Heterobranchia). Edizioni Danaus, Palermo, pp. 1– 111 with 41 unnumbered plates (figs. 1-363), appendix pp. 1–91.page(s): 54, appendix p. 13, 60
